posts.post_content:
Why is this in the Izzet deck rather than [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder) / [Preordain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Preordain)?  
  
It's simple, actually. With [Niv-Mizzet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet) out, this becomes a [Lava Spike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Spike).  
  
I'm really curious why [Curiosity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Curiosity) wasn't included into the Izzet deck, though...
posts.html:
Why is this in the Izzet deck rather than Ponder / Preordain?

It's simple, actually. With Niv-Mizzet out, this becomes a Lava Spike.

I'm really curious why Curiosity wasn't included into the Izzet deck, though...

posts.post_content:
@ saucyninja007  
  
Suprisingly bad? do you understand what this card does? you don't use this to dig through your library you use it to perfect your hand and to get to choose what to draw over the next two turns, giving you a free card in hand to replace itself - excellent card advantage, also allowing for the desired triggering of [Delver of Secrets](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delver of Secrets), or any miracle, which can usually result in complete victory. Just because you don't know how to run a card does not make it "bad" by any means, it just reflects your skills as a player.

posts.post_content:
Story-related art in a story-related deck, even though this card won't be part of that block or legal in related formats.  
I couldn't imagine a better realization of a reprint for a card from a Duel Decks series, very cool!  
  
Her appearance seems to be inspired or even a hommage to the Mercadian Masques art, although i might be wrong with that. It's probably just the blue-ish hair.  
  
Also, 5.00/5 with 20 votes as of now. Go Brainstorm!
